entry.content:
To start with and add a bit of context, I think we can all say that there is a reasonable amount of articles that show us different techniques to improve our code and make it simpler, right?

But how many of those articles tell us why should we write simpler code? What should drives us toward writing simpler code? What are the benefits of doing it? Is there anything better than simpler code that we should focus on to improve our software design?

To be good programmers, we should understand why do we do some things and avoid being "mentally mechanical", because it's easy to read a blog post and apply some of the code techniques but is that all we can do to make our code simpler? What's the ultimate goal of simple code?
